Description: Handle zone sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Droop cup; interior glazed (fired brownish); exterior black lip above black-figure decoration consisting of dancing female figure to left (lower body lost; added white for flesh and added red and white on garment).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 90 no. 306 pl. 67)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 426, no. B675, pl. XXVIII, pl. CCVIII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1411) (phase 3)
